Module dev.progress4j.api
Package dev.progress4j.api

Interface MutableProgressReport

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ProgressReport
    public interface MutableProgressReport
extends ProgressReport
    A specialization of ProgressReport that allows changing the contents of the report, which is useful for managing progress in tight loops without flooding the GC with new small objects.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface dev.progress4j.api.ProgressReport

        ProgressReport.Trackable, ProgressReport.Tracker, ProgressReport.Units

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void increment​(long value)
      Increments the completed work by value, capped to ProgressReport.getExpectedTotal()}.

      Sets the specified value for completed.

      Sets the specified expected total.
      void setMessage​(@Nullable java.lang.String message)
      Sets the specified message, or null to indicate no message.

      • Methods inherited from interface dev.progress4j.api.ProgressReport

        getComplete, getCompleted, getExpectedTotal, getIndeterminate, getMessage, getSubReports, getUnits, immutableReport, mutableReport, withCompleted, withExpectedTotal, withIncremented, withMessage, withSubReport, withSubReports

    • Method Detail

      • setCompleted

        void setCompleted​(long value)
        Sets the specified value for completed.

      • increment

        void increment​(long value)
        Increments the completed work by value, capped to ProgressReport.getExpectedTotal()}.

      • setExpectedTotal

        void setExpectedTotal​(long value)
        Sets the specified expected total. If ProgressReport.getCompleted() is higher than the new expected total, it is set to the new value (i.e. 100% and thus ProgressReport.getComplete() by default would return true).

      • setMessage

        void setMessage​(@Nullable
                @Nullable java.lang.String message)
        Sets the specified message, or null to indicate no message.

      • setSubReports

        void setSubReports​(@NotNull
                   @NotNull java.util.Collection<? extends @Nullable ProgressReport> subReports)
        Sets the specified sub-reports.

      • setSubReport

        void setSubReport​(int index,
                  @Nullable
                  @Nullable ProgressReport subReport)
        Replaces the specified sub-report. The index must be between 0 (inclusive) and the size of ProgressReport.getSubReports() (exclusive).
